Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mahmoud A
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel from 10 t0 14 january I have enjoyed my stay, specialy the staff was helpful and professional on their work. The bartender Erhan he was always very kind to us The rooms was ok.very clean there was renovatin at the hotel , The staff told me the hotel improwing the quality and going to be a premier quality. If I come to istanbul again I will defenitely prefer senator again.Ofcourse I will recomend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Brock53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this place for five days November 2011. Our room was on the fourth floor and was definitely one of the most depressing rooms I have stayed in my life. The only window looked out into a narrow shaft which made the air in the room extremely stuffy and ventilation almost non-existant. Furniture was old, dark and would certainly need replacing. Breakfast was quite okay though sometimes the breakfast lobby was overrun during busy times in the morning so that it was hard to find a free table. As other reviewers have remarked fresh fruit juice is an extra sold at a hefty surcharge. Location is good though - 15 to 20 minutes leisurely walk to the main attractions like Hagia Sophia or the Blue Mosque, and the tram is just a couple of minutes down the road if you don't like to walk. The worst happened when we checked out. When we had arrived from the airport we took an airport taxi which dropped us at the hotel after a twenty minute ride at a reasonable price. For our return to the airport we asked the hotel reception to organize a taxi. Although the price they gave us was way above what we had paid for the airport taxi we accepted as it was the convenient option. It turned out that the "taxi" was a shuttle bus which was supposed to take six other people as well. To our amazement the driver drove us round the hotel only to stop in front of it after ten minutes declaring that he wouldn't drive us to the hotel. After our complaints the people at the reception promised to call another driver who finally drove eight people to the airport in his minibus, dropping some of his buddies on the way. From what we know from friends you will get much better value elsewhere in Istanbul - and if you insist on this place make sure you're not put into a dump like our room.

Reviews.Title: “You can find much better for the price. Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: BobbyPtravels
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for last part of my stay at turkey, when I was looking for a hotel the reviews for this hotel were not that great but not bad and the images were okay, however the reality of the hotel is terrible. The plants in the Lobby are plastic and not clean, the concierge is a desk in the lobby. Gym is a very small room as part of the "spa" and has 3 machines from the 70s, it is not open most of the day and costs about 10 dollars a day if you choose to work out/ injure yourself in it. There were cracks in the rooms wall, the tv had about 10 channels to choose from and it was probably the first edition of the flat screens. The view of our suit was a brunt down building on one side and a small park surranded by run down buildings ( as bad as shanghai's residentials) on the other Side.The bar was very small and very poor selection of drinks and very overpriced! There is only two elevators in the hotel and they are very small, only two people can fit in them, one if you have luggage. The furniture is very old and the decores are very tacky and cheap. Food quality is terrible and the breakfast buffet is limited and not fresh. If you want fresh juice you need to pay for it extras and it is called the vitamin bar, what a joke. Front desk staff were not very friendly, the manager told us he had to hold our passport because their computer system is down? Now I travel about two to three times a year internationally and I know some hotels hold passports to make sure they get paid especially in third world countries but I had already pre paid for our room and breakfast, and their computer didn't have a problem checking us in!!! The only good thing about the hotel is its distance to old town tourist sites but so are 100s of other hotels. For an American chain of hotel this was a complete disaster on all accounts, I am very disappointed and will never stay at a best western hotel, senator or not. Here is another hint, if the four stars is part of the name banner outside, it does not make a four star hotel... The irony to the situation is that I paid the same amount of money for the first part of the trip in a hotel at taqsim square and it was an amazing experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Bye Bye Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JOAO S
Reviews.Content: I went to Turkey for a tour for some cities. Last night in Istanbul I stayed at Best Western Senator. A nice lobby, comfortable rooms, free internet, gentle staff. Breakfast with black coffee, at last. Nice food. Very good location, few minutes turist atractions. I would be back, I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “ausgezeichnet , we can recommend the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernestine M
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Senator Hotel in September and we enjoyed it very much, we are Best Western members and our friends who travelled with us joined now too, everyone in the hotel was very friendly, very good service at the reception, the breakfast and the staff there very helpfull, made us TÃ¼rkish tea every morning, which we love now, the location was perfect,10 min. to walk to the train but close to every important place, good shops and restaurants very close too We went on a cruise and when we returned to the Senator Best Wetern Hotel for 3 more days we got an upgrade, which was super, we thank the reception for their kindness and also recommend the good restaurant in the hote, we are planing to go back in March again, because we also loved ISTANBUL, kind regards from Erni + Hasso MÃ¼ller

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: emmy_bug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a weekend in a triple room. After enquiring about the airport shuttle before departure I was told it would be 20â‚¬ to get to the hotel (roughly the same price as a normal taxi). The hotel is well situated but it is not in the best location as it's on a side street. The staff are on the whole very helpful and polite. They are very helpful with local knowledge and information - which was greatly appreciated. The bar was quite highly priced (31lira for a small bottle of white wine) but it was one of the only places where you could find alcohol easily. Room was "OK". We had a triple room and it turned out to be 3 single beds. Our view was nothing spectacular (the back of the hotel) but it was quiet. One of the sheets had a rip in it - something that i wouldnt expect from a 4* hotel - but when i spoke to the cleaner - it was replaced immediately - again an example of the fantastic staff that they have here. The biggest "issue" for me was the lack of a free gym. You had to pay 10â‚¬ each time you wanted to use it. This again was something that amazed me a little bit (especially as they advised against running outside). The Hammam looked lovely and the lady on the reception there was very helpful about what they offered and the availability. Breakfast was ok -but the eggs were substandard on two of the three days (hard boiled eggs that were running, or you could not crack off the shells). The potatoes were often cold but the bread and pastries were lovely and fresh. I wouldnt stay at this hotel again for the following reasons: - The gym wasnt free - Breakfast quality - Location (it's central but not in the best area)

Reviews.Title: “Senator Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CelebrityFan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here before our cruise from Istanbul. This hotel was booked through British Airways and we were told that they had a Shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. After booking we found out that this was not the case and the Hotel said we would have to find our own way from airport to hotel. This was then resolved by British Airways and we noticed that the mention of the shuttle has since been removed from the Hotel Web site. We must say that we found the hotel to be very pleasant and the staff went out of their way to help with cases etc. Very well presented breakfast which was included in the price of the room. Only negative about this hotel was they fact that we were awakend quite early by the call to prayer from the Mosque which is quite close to the hotel. Prices for drinks in the bar are also quite high but the proximity to all the attractions is quite good. It is only a short walk to the Tram station from the hotel and you can get to most places by buying a Jeton for 2 Turkish Lira. I would stay here again if we were to visit Istanbul. Clean and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikial2
Reviews.Content: Good nice hotel senator toppie 20 minute from Sultan Ahmet you can go the tram!!! Nice hotel yes good

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury and comfort”
Reviews.Author: hcinco
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hote. The staff was very knowledgeable, and corteous. The hotel lobby made a simple impression, but the rooms were clean. The bathroom was equally clean, and well stocked. The bed was comfortable The only negative was the proxximity of the call to prayer. But, this is not the fault of the hotel. I recommend this hotel, and will return this Novemer. Follow up to this review will be made after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but average experience”
Reviews.Author: Mystique00
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a 20min walk to Ahmet Sultan and Grand Bazaar, that is, if you walk briskly. The hotel lobby was nice, however the rooms were average. The air-conditioning was not very effective, and the rooms had sheets instead of blankets (hint: the limited air-conditioning is a permanent situation). The breakfast was awful - dry bread, boiled eggs and an assortment of jams and cheese. Thats it.Oh and coffee. The property does not have a swimming pool and the bar closes early in the evening. The staff are friendly and helpful, and really helped us with our tours and transfer info.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good breakfast--not sure what the others are complaining about”
Reviews.Author: Lucre20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Senator recently. In my experience, this hotel was perfectly acceptable. The location is quite good. It is a longish walk to Grand Bazaar (about 15 minutes) but it is entirely doable and a straight shot down the main road. If you are not up for walking, you can take the tram, which is conveniently located close to the hotel. I can see how the walk might be an issue for less fit/older guests/kids, but if you are in good shape, the walk is not bad at all. The rooms are clean and our room, which faced the back, didn't have a great view but we were not in Istanbul to appreciate the view out of our hotel room! We were there during Ramadan and could hear the call to prayer, but it was not loud or bothersome. The breakfast buffet is quite nice too. It doesn't change, but there is a wide variety of breads, cheeses, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, yogurts, granola, cereal, eggs, potatoes, sausages etc in addition to tea/coffee and juices. If you go in expecting some fantastic culinary experience then you are sure to be disappointed. But as far as buffet breakfasts go, this one was just fine. The one unexpected and pleasant find was a small restaurant across the street--can't remember the exact name but it is Laleli Kebap or something similar. We had dinner there two nights; they are open late (we sat down to eat at 11 PM one night) so it is a convenient option if you have a flight that arrives late. The food is hearty and tasty and the service is good, albeit slow. Don't miss the rice pudding dessert here!! Finally, the Best Western is not the Four Seasons, but it is decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “we had an excellent stay here would recomend it ,,,”
Reviews.Author: doris065
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in june and found the hygiene to be really good, staff were really helpful, any thing you needed they were there to help bulent kersu, the resturant manager, was really helpful and ur needs were meet if you had a problem. i would recommend this hotel for any one staff alway had a smile and was really good. i enjoyed my stay here and the area is lovely beautiful place. the food was really nice and breafast was lovely. The hotel is well located with transport options readily available to take you across the tourist areas of this vibrant city. We managed to walk easily to the Grand Bazaar and down to the waterfront at the Ataturk Bridge. The hotels rooms are comfortable and well appointed with all the necessaries to make your stay pleasant. There is even a small grocery shop across the street for snacks, fruit and water. In comparison to other hotels on our tour the prices within the hotel are very reasonable. i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Istambul's best hotel.”
Reviews.Author: angelylebanc
Reviews.Content: Turkey is a very friendly place to spend your vacations! They are definitely tourism oriented! This was our second visit to this wonderful country and the first visit to Istanbul, (our first time there we visited Ismir). Istambul is amazing! My husband and I had an urgettable time... The kids loved it. The hotel is located in the old city center, less than two miles away from the Train Station and seven miles away from the International airport. There is a tram and a bus station a block away from the hotel! The tram is easy to use and cheap. Talking about the area, you can walk to the historical and cultural beauties nearby like the Grand bazaar, the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia Museum. A tip: take a bag with you so you can keep your shoes near while entering the Mosques, our tour guide told us sometimes shoes disappear if you leave them outside... Well, in case you need or want to go shopping, visit the Galeria shopping mall. If you want an expensive and beautiful souvenir buy a handmade rug, they are so beautiful... The Best Western Senator besides being perfectly located is nice and comfortable, my room had a mini bar, cofffee maker, cable lcd tv, self controlled heating and cooling system and a clothes press; the bathroom was very neat (which is super important for me). The hotel features a full equipped gym, a vitamin bar and a Turkish bath! The front desk is open 24 hours and the concierge is very helpful, he booked tours for us and geve us helpful information. There is a restaurant on site with affordable prices and a cocktail lounge shich serves complimentary soft drinks. By the way, another hotel plus is that they serve a complimentary breakfast, whis is very good. I would recommend this hotel for couples and families as well.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: Sbjuliana
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, is 15-min walk distance from the Grand Bazar, and 25 min from the Blue Mosque. But I didnÂ´t find the hotel very atractive. The services were poor, and in my room there were nothing about the hotel services, such as internet or gym, or even a menu for room service. My window view was very poor as well, and the loudspeaker of the mosque can really bother you. And when people are talking in the corridor, it seens that itÂ´s in your room, since the walls are too thin. Has a free wi fi internet on the room, and the breakfast is not that much.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT value for money”
Reviews.Author: PDMKolkata
Reviews.Content: Read all the bad reviews after my travel agent booked this hotel for our trip. Unfortunately it was too late to cancel. Like others, I m also surprised that this is a four star property. The least you expect in a 4* hotel is a swimming pool! There is a small gym which is a paid service. Don't know the gym timings though as at 11 am one day the door was shut (not locked) with all lights switched off. Our room was very small with nothing much to boast of. There was no bath towel in the bathroom and when I called housekeeping I got 5 hand towels instead! Buffet breakfast is just about okay. A word of caution, whatever their claims might be, this hotel is not exactly 'walking distance' to the happening part of the city. You need to walk for at least 30 mins to reach Sultanahmet Square. The only good thing about this hotel is free wi-fi service in the rooms. And yes, the neighbourhood is quiet. Even then, room charges are too high for the services. If you still book your room here, remember that the nearest tram station is Asratay (2mins walk)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Istanbul ever”
Reviews.Author: DK-Desi
Reviews.Content: We had the best hotel experience at Best Western Senator Hotel Istanbul ever. I have been in Istanbul 3 times and stayed at different hotels each time. The best service recieved so far was at Best Western Senator. We had book 3 rooms including children through travelocity. However upon our arrival we were told that we had only booked 3 rooms with two single beds in each room. I provided the hotel with a printout that I had. As the frontdesk manager had a day off we were upgraded to suites for the first day and was told by the reception to talk with the front desk manager the day after. We did so and after a short conversation we were told, that we shouldÂ´nt worry about the mess up of information between travelocity and the hotel. We were there allowed to keep our suites for the rest of our trip. The suites were big in size and with alot of comfort. See the attached photoes. The staff is wonderfull and very service oriented. Breakfast is good with a good choice. The downside is that there is not changes made to the breakfast during the week. However the staff in the restaurant was very polite and serviceminded. As we were travelling with children we were allowed to bring the breakfast to the rooms as the children was tired and did not wake up before 10.am which is the closing time for breakfast. The hotel and the rooms are very clean and it was a pleasure to come back to the hotel after af whole day in wonderfull Istanbul. For dinner avoid restaurants in the old city close to Grand Bazar and Blue Mosque as you will get bad quality food for high price. Look for restaurants with local people. There is good outdoor restaurant just around the corner from Best Western Senator hotel. We had the best food experiences in shopping malls and around Taksim Square. We would definately go back to Best Western Senator hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inaccurate & Outdated Information from Website”
Reviews.Author: mytable8co
Reviews.Content: We shall begin with the positves - we rate it HIGH on hygiene, staff friendliness but LOW on location, star rating (note: this is NOT a 4 or 5 star hotel but more of a 2 star.) The information we obtained from the website says that all historical/places of interests were walking distance (e.g. 15 minutes) but this is probably true (only) for Suleimaniye Mosque; the Grand Bazaar and other places in the Old City are NOT 15 minutes walk at all - it was more like a 15 minute cab ride. Also, the website photos of the hotel was probably taken when the hotel was first built as today, it is very run-down on the outside. The room is small (very European like) and the amenities are almost non-existence. The gym is chargeable and the massage costs too much. The breakfast got old really fast as they kept serving the same choices every day; and we stayed for 8 days! Overall, our experience at the Best Western Senator Hotel was nothing to shout about. We will return to Istanbul, a GREAT city but will definitely NOT put up at any Best Western hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent priced place”
Reviews.Author: bahia83
Reviews.Content: for what you get. Area might not be 4 star but hey it's not dead.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Enough for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Mahlerfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the old part of Istanbul, near the university, about a 15-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and a half-hour walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is also a couple of blocks from the tram stop which goes to those sites if one doesn't care to walk. The neighborhood seemed fairly safe and there were several decent restaurants nearby and a market across the street. The staff was friendly and efficient; however the hotel's lobby internet connection did not function during my stay. The room was on the small side, but adequately appointed. The bed was also small but adequate in terms of comfort. The walls are somewhat thin and you can hear your neighbors talking. The complimentary breakfast was tasty and the hotel's rates were reasonable. I would not, however, rate this as a four-star property--it is, in my opinion, a three-star hotel, at best.

Reviews.Title: “who says it's a four star?”
Reviews.Author: manaSeoul
Reviews.Content: i'm not even sure it fits three star level. Yes, the staff was hospitable, breakfast modest, the lobby looked cheap but who cares. The problem in fact was not the lobby, service or the breakfast. It was the room, which was small and poorly insulated. I had to literally wrap myself with two duvets and still felt cold. The bed was really tiny that I, a slim sized woman of average height, found it too small. Outside the window was horrid, with bird droppings everywhere. One of my colleague got a room for the handicapped, which of course was not what he requested. He didn't know it was designed for special needs but just found it interesting that his showerroom had a chair inside the shower curtain. Those who will be happy with guesthouse or B&B style accommodations, however, might find it reasonably good and affordable. But for those who expected a four star hotel and a room where one can relax, it's a no-no.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotel to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Marcel80
Reviews.Content: Hotel arranged for us airport transportation, the car was at the airport on time the driver meet us at the exit gate of airport and helped our luggages to get on the car aproximitels 30 minutes later we gat to the hotel.We were surprised about the ambiance of the hotel.it is very well designed and decorated hotel .The reception staff welcome us very friendly professinaly .It was very expres check in .The belman helped our luggages , after few minutes we were in our room.The room decoration was high quality.very clean bathroom.We enjoyed the breakfast service,it was open buffet service.Some times we were late for breakfast but still the service staff served us the breakfast for free.All service staff and housekeeping staff were so kind to us.There was a lady at guest service she was so kind ,every morning she meet us and asking is everything ok.with the hotel services.This hotel raiting is oficialy shows four star but we belive that we have got five star hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Defenitely recomended hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonS076
Reviews.Content: this hotel recomended me by a friend,I am realy very satisfied about my stay. it is verywell organised hotel the rooms are very clean,smiling staff fine breakfast buffet. Rooms are confortable, it is free internet wi fi access. also there is a free internet kiosk free for the hotel guests. central location .

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: BrazucaMiami
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for two days stop over in Istambul. Very good located (Old City) about 15 minutes walk to the Grand Bazar and 25 minutes to Blue Mosque. Fast check in and good room. Free wireless internet. LCD TV set with CNN and BBC channels. Don't be late for breakfast because they close the door at 10:00 am sharp!! But don't worry, you won't miss to much. Restaurant service is poor. Natural orange juice is charged (2.50 euros).

Reviews.Title: “Defintitley a place I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: uglypup007
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on a whim due to location and proximity to the Grand Bazar, and price. Had been stay with Ibis Hotel chains across Europe. Istanbul Ibis was too far from the city. Excellent choice. From the moment I got there the staff was excellent. Restaurant meal was superb, although I only ate there on the first of 2 nights. Local fair was the order of the day for the next 2 days. Clean, elegant for the price. A little out of the way compared to a few other hotels, but no so much to be an issue. Helps with the quiet. Free internet was a great bonus. It was a great experience. Istanbul and Best Western Senator Hotel Gencturk Caddesi - Sirvanizade Sokak 7, Istanbul 34470 is definitely on the list of places to go again. Next time for more than 2 nights.

HotelInfo.Name: Best Western Senator Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Gencturk Caddesi, Sirvanizade Sokak, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
